intro: Crassina angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crassina, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red in color, which bloom during the summer months. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Crassina angustifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate saline conditions and high levels of sunlight.
